actionable_tasks.title: Complete MongoDB TTL Indexes (remaining 50%)
actionable_tasks.description: Finish implementing MongoDB TTL indexes at 50% progress. TTL indexes automatically expire documents after a set time, ideal for logs, sessions, or temporary data in EchoTune AI.
implementation_steps: Identify collections needing TTL (e.g., chat sessions, temp recommendations) via MongoDB shell or Compass.
Add TTL indexes: db.collection.createIndex({ "expiresAt": 1 }, { expireAfterSeconds: 3600 }) for 1-hour expiry.
Update relevant models/schemas to include expiresAt field with TTL date.
Test by inserting sample docs and verifying auto-deletion after expiry.
Run npm run lint and commit with message 'Complete MongoDB TTL indexes'

actionable_tasks.title: Expand Performance Monitoring to p50/p95 Tracking (60% remaining)
actionable_tasks.description: Performance monitoring at 40% complete; add p50/p95 latency percentiles for API endpoints to meet Q1 2026 target of <200ms p95.
implementation_steps: Install or use existing Prometheus client or StatsD for histograms.
Instrument key endpoints (e.g., /chat, /spotify/play) with timing middleware.
Calculate p50/p95 from histogram buckets; log to MongoDB or console.
Add dashboard query for visualization in analytics UI.
Test under load with Artillery or similar; verify metrics in logs.

Add integration test for provider switching endpoint.
Run coverage report; aim for +5-10% gain; update package.json scripts if needed.

actionable_tasks.title: Add Docker Optimization for Multi-Stage Builds
actionable_tasks.description: Optimize Docker for production: implement multi-stage builds to reduce image size and improve caching for Node backend and React frontend.
implementation_steps: Create multi-stage Dockerfile: builder stage for npm install, runtime stage for copy node_modules.
Use .dockerignore for node_modules, git, etc.
Add docker-compose for dev with volumes; test build with docker build --no-cache.
Benchmark image size reduction (target <500MB combined).
Push to registry if applicable; document in README.
